member.name: T:Netick.SingleInstanceEnforcer
member.summary: Add this component to a GameObject to ensure only a single instance of it will exist at the same time, across all sandboxes.

member.name: F:Netick.ServerPacket.SrvTickTime
member.summary: Server tick time - very handy to detect GC freezes (or any performance issues) from client POV.

member.name: T:Netick.NetworkRigidbody
member.summary: This component is used to replicate the position and rotation of an object. Therefore, it’s the same as the Network Transform, the difference is that Network Rigidbody must be used if you want to have client-side prediction over PhysX objects since it replicates several other properties necessary for correct prediction.

member.name: T:Netick.Rpc
member.summary:
Use this attribute on any method you want to make an RPC. Should have the return type of void, and not be static.
* Use the parameter "source" to specify who is allowed to send this RPC.
* Use the parameter "target" to specify who is allowed to receive and execute this RPC.
* Use the parameter "isReliable" to specify if this Rpc should be reliable or not, meaning it won't be lost (due to packet loss).
* Use the parameter "localInvoke" to specify if this Rpc should be executed on the machine it was called from.

member.name: T:Netick.OnChanged
member.summary:
Use this attribute on a method you want to call when a specific property value changes. Example: [OnChanged(nameof(PropertyName)]
Note: if used on network array, the method should have one parameter to be used as an index. If not used on an array, it should be parameterless.

member.name: T:Netick.Networked
member.summary:
Use this attribute on any property you want to replicate/sync.
* If this property is a network array, use the parameter "size" to specify the size of the array.
* (compression) If you want set a precision for this property, use the parameter "precision". Only works on Float/Vector3/Vector2/Quaternion.
* (compression) If you want set a maximum value for this property, use the parameter "max". Only works on Int.
* (compression) If you want set a minimum value for this property, use the parameter "min". Only works on Int.

member.name: T:Netick.Smooth
member.summary:
Use this attribute on any property you want to interpolate/smooth. And you would automatically get interpolated values when accessing the property in NetRender.
* If you want to always use server data (snapshots) for interpolation, pass true to parameter "serverDataInterpolation"

member.name: T:Netick.EntityReplicationConditions
member.summary: A struct to store client-specific encoding information for each entity.

member.name: F:Netick.EntityReplicationConditions.HasParent
member.summary: Entity Initialization data

member.name: T:Netick.NetworkRigidbody2D
member.summary: This component is used to replicate the position and rotation of an object. Therefore, it’s the same as the Network Transform, the difference is that Network Rigidbody 2D must be used if you want to have client-side prediction over Box2D objects since it replicates several other properties necessary for correct prediction.

member.name: T:Netick.NetworkSandbox
member.summary: Network Sandbox is what controls the whole network simulation. It can be thought of as the manager of the simulation. You can have more than one network sandbox in a single Unity game, and that happens when you start both a client and a server on the same project. This can be extremely useful for testing/debugging, because it allows you to run a server and a client(or multiple thereof) in the same project and therefore see what happens at both at the same time, without interference.

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkSandbox.ConnectedClients
member.summary:
A list containing all connected clients currently.
Note: if you want the clients + the server, use .

summary.para: A list containing all connected clients currently, in addition to the server.
Note: if you only want the clients, use .

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkSandbox.GetObject(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the with the specified id. Returns null in case no object with that id exists.

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkSandbox.TryGetObject(System.Int32,Netick.NetworkObject@)
member.summary: Trys to get the with the specified id.

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkSandbox.TryGetBehaviour``1(System.Int32,``0@)
member.summary: Trys to get the of a with the specified id.
member.param: The id of the network object

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkSandbox.NetworkInstantiate(UnityEngine.GameObject,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Quaternion,Netick.NetworkPlayer,Netick.SpawnPredictionKey)
member.summary:
Instantiates a network prefab.
Commonly, this should only be called on the server, since only the server can instantiate network prefabs. However, the client can also call this to spawn-predict a prefab by providing a spawn key which must be the same on the server and client when this method is called. Read the docs to learn more about how to use spawn-prediction.
Note: make sure the prefab has been registered.
Note: the specified input source will be given to every child of this prefab.
member.param: Input source of the instantiated object.

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkSandbox.Instantiate(UnityEngine.GameObject,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Quaternion)
member.summary:
Instantiates a prefab. This must be called instead of or its variations.
Note: this must be called only for non-networked prefabs. If you want to instantiate a network prefab, use instead.

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkSandbox.Destroy(Netick.NetworkObject)
member.summary:
Destroys a network object. Only call this on the server or on the client for spawn-predicted objects which have -1 Ids.
Note: never call this on a child of the original prefab, only the root of the prefab.

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkSandbox.SendRpc(Netick.NetworkRPC)
member.summary: Internal method. Never call this.

member.summary: Internal method. Never call this.

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkSandbox.InitializePool(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Initializes the pool for the specified prefab. After this method has been called for a certain prefab, all instances of that prefab will be recycled and reset when created/destroyed.
Note: this method should only be called on , in other words, just after Netick has been started.
member.param: How many instances to be preloaded.
Pass true to hide inactive pool members.

Gets a Network Prefab by name.

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkSandbox.Tick
member.summary:
Current simulation tick.
On the server, it's always going forward/increasing.
On the client, during resimulations it returns the current resimulated tick. To check for resimulations, use .

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkSandbox.IsResimulating
member.summary: Returns true if we are currently resimulating a previous input/tick of the past. On the server, it always returns false since only the clients resimulate.

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkSandbox.IsApplyingReceivedData
member.summary: Returns true when the client is at the stage of appling received server data.

member.summary:

member.summary:
[Client Only] Connects to a remote server.
Note: if you are already connected to a server, and you want to connect to a different one, you have to disconnect before calling this. Otherwise this method does nothing.
Note: connectionData array length should not be more than 200.
member.param: Data sent with the connection request. Could be used to decide whether or not to allow the connection.

member.name: M:Netick.Network.Init(Netick.NetworkTransport,Netick.NetickConfig,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Initializes Netick. This is automatically called when you start Netick.
If you don't provide a , Netick will use the default config, which can be modified/found in (Netick -> Settings).
If you don't provide a , Netick will use the transport assigned in (Netick -> Settings -> Transport).

member.summary:
The networked index of this player.

Note: the server player always has Id 0.

member.name: P:Netick.NetickBehaviour.Sandbox
member.summary: The containing this .

member.name: P:Netick.NetickBehaviour.Object
member.summary: The this behaviour is attached to.

member.name: M:Netick.NetickBehaviour.NetworkStart
member.summary: Called when this behaviour has been added to the simulation.

member.name: M:Netick.NetickBehaviour.NetworkDestroy
member.summary: Called when this behaviour has been removed from the simulation.

member.name: M:Netick.NetickBehaviour.NetworkUpdate
member.summary: Called every frame. Executed before NetworkFixedUpdate.

member.name: M:Netick.NetickBehaviour.NetworkRender
member.summary:
Called every frame. Executed after NetworkUpdate and NetworkFixedUpdate.
IMPORTANT NOTE: properties (which can be interpolated) marked with [] attribute will return interpolated values when accessed in this method.

member.name: M:Netick.NetickBehaviour.NetworkFixedUpdate
member.summary:
Called every fixed-time network update/tick. Any changes/updates to the network state must happen here.
On the client, if you are the Input Source or if this Object.PredictionMode is set to Everyone, it will be called several times in one update/tick during resimulations. To check for resimulations, use [].

member.name: T:Netick.NetworkBehaviour
member.summary: Network Behaviour is the base class for all behaviours that need to be networked.

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.Id
member.summary: The network id of this .

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.IsClient
member.summary: Returns true if this is a client.

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.IsServer
member.summary: Returns true if this is the server.

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.IsOwner
member.summary: Returns true if this is the owner of this Object. In this version of Netick: Server=Owner.

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.IsInputSource
member.summary: Returns true if this is providing inputs to this Object.

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.IsProxy
member.summary: Returns true if we neither provide inputs nor own this .

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.IsResimulating
member.summary: Returns true if we are currently resimulating a previous input of the past. On the server, it always returns false since only the clients resimulate.

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.InputSource
member.summary: Returns the source (/) of inputs for this . If the source of inputs is remote (from a client) it returns that , while on the input source itself it returns the local .

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.NetworkReset
member.summary:
Called when this Object (which's part of a networked prefab) has been recycled. It's used to reset the state of networked prefabs for reuse later. Make sure to reset the object correctly.
Note: all network properties are auto-reset to their declaration value by Netick. Therefore, you only need to reset non-networked fields which need to be reset.
Note: this is only called if pooling is activated for this prefab.

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.OnInputPermitted
member.summary: Called when this has been granted permission to provide inputs to this Object.

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.OnInputRevoked
member.summary: Called when this has been revoked from providing inputs to this Object.

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.OnInputSourceLeft
member.summary: Called on the server when the input source of this Object has disconnected.

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.OnSpawnPredictionSucceeded
member.summary: Called on the client when the server confirms that this object has been successfully spawn-predicted and therefore has a valid Id.

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.ApplyToBehaviour
member.summary: Overrides this to apply the Unity's component (or third-party component) state into the network state (network properties) of this .

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkBehaviour.ApplyToComponent
member.summary: Overrides this to apply the network state (network properties) of this into the Unity's component (or third-party component) state.

A rolling sequence counter for ordering values. Repeats indefinitely with 1022 possible unique values (0 is treated as invalid internally).
Consumes 10 bits when encoded for transmission.

member.summary: Returns the source (/) of inputs for this . If the source of inputs is remote (from a client) it returns that , while on the input source itself it returns the local .

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkObject.IsProxy
member.summary: Returns true if we neither provide inputs nor own this .

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkObject.IsOwner
member.summary: Returns true if this is the owner of this . In this version of Netick: Server=Owner.

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkObject.IsInputSource
member.summary: Returns true if this is providing inputs for this .

member.name: P:Netick.NetworkObject.IsResimulating
member.summary: Returns true if we are currently resimulating a previous input of the past. On the server, it always returns false since only the clients resimulate.

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkObject.SetParent(Netick.NetworkObject)
member.summary: [Owner/InputSource Only] Changes the parent of this object.
member.param: The object which will become the parent of this object.

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkObject.PermitInput(Netick.NetworkPlayer)
member.summary: [Owner Only] Permit to provide inputs to this object.
member.param: The player to be given permission.

member.name: M:Netick.NetworkObject.RevokeInput
member.summary: [Owner Only] Removes the current Input Source () of this object.
